layers.title: Indian Landslide Susceptibility Map 2024
layers.description: Potential of slope failure for given geo-environmental conditions. landslide susceptibility mapping using ensemble machine learning and geospatial big data. See source code for technical details.
layers.attribution: Indian Landslide Susceptibility Map (ILSM) (100m), Hydrosense Lab, IIT-Delhi

layers.title: Landcover
layers.description: Space based Information Support for Decentralized Planning (SISDP) Phase 2 10k Land Usage Land Cover data. Check the SISDP technical manual for background about the project and Bhuvan Panchayat Portal User Manual for more details.

layers.title: Geomorphological Lineaments

layers.title: Groundwater Prospects
layers.description:
Groundwater prospect maps prepared at 1:50k scale. Refer to the methodology and user manual for more details. Check INDIA-Groundwater Resource Estimation System (IN-GRES) for taluk level groundwater assessment reports.
View Dynamic Groundwater Report of Goa State 2022 | 2024.
layers.attribution: Bhuvan - Bhujal, Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation - Collected by Datameet Community

layers.attribution: Bhuvan - Collected by Datameet Community

layers.title: National Landslide Susceptibility Map
layers.description: The landslide susceptibility maps show the total area classified into high, moderate and low zones based on their relative likelihood of susceptibility to landslide initiation, and can be used as a vital geo-information tool for regional land-use planning in landslide prone fragile slopes. GSI also collected information on 91,000 historical landslides using both remote sensing (RS) and field-based source data. A total number of 33,904 landslides are field validated and the database is continuously being updated with the new landslide data collected year-wise as part of post-disaster studies. Statewise landslide reports are available at GSI
layers.attribution: National Landslide Susceptibility Mapping (NLSM), Geological Survey Of India via Bhukosh
